Package tests.sic.rnqt.nbin

tests.sic.rnqt.nbin package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (R,nQ,T) facing stochastic demands that are distributed according to the Negative Binomial distribution (a compound Poisson distribution where customers arrive at intervals that are spaced according to the Poisson distribution, but their order quantities are logarithmically distributed instead of being always single unit demands) in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    RnQTCnbin
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Negative Binomial process with parameters λ>0, p_l>0.
    RnQTCnbin.IIP
    auxiliary class for integrating the (1-D) function described in eval().
    RnQTCnbinBoxed
    the class extends the RnQTCnbin class with the functionality that it projects any argument for evaluation into the feasible region of the class.
    RnQTCnbinFixedTHeurPOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 4 double values.
    RnQTCnbinFixedTHeurPOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of heuristically optimizing an RnQTCnbin function, with a fixed review period T.
    RnQTCnbinFixedTOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (R,nQ,T) policy, namely the reorder point R and the batch size Q variables, for given (fixed) review period T.
    RnQTCnbinFixedTOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 6 double values.
    RnQTCnbinFixedTOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of optimizing an RnQTCnbin function, with a fixed review period T.
    RnQTCnbinHeurOpt
    class implements an approximate heuristic optimizer over ALL three variables of the (R,nQ,T) policy, namely the reorder point R, the batch size Q and the review period T as described in Christou, Skouri and Lagodimos (2020): "Fast evaluation of a periodic review inventory policy", Computers and Industrial Engineering, 144.
    RnQTCnbinHeurPOpt
    class implements the same logic as the RnQTCnbinHeurOpt class, but runs in parallel for different contiguous values of the review period T.
    RnQTCnbinOpt
    class implements an optimizer over ALL three variables of the (R,nQ,T) policy, namely the reorder point R, the batch size Q and the review period T.

Package tests.sic.rnqt.nbin Description

tests.sic.rnqt.nbin package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (R,nQ,T) facing stochastic demands that are distributed according to the Negative Binomial distribution (a compound Poisson distribution where customers arrive at intervals that are spaced according to the Poisson distribution, but their order quantities are logarithmically distributed instead of being always single unit demands) in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

Package Specification

The formulae for the average cost of such a system are taken from the classic IE textbook of Hadley and Whitin, "Analysis of Inventory Systems", 1963. It is worth noting here that numerical integration is involved in the computation of the back-order costs as closed form formulae are not readily available.
